column3: str

<UIForeground>F201FC</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FD</UIGlow> Quest Sync<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
Riqi-Mao is anything but calm.
Speak with the amaro handler.
Use the whittled whistle to search for the amaro.
Speak with the amaro handler.
Report to Riqi-Mao.
You there! Get ready to run! Time is of the essence!
Our new amaro has escaped into the forest! The carnivorous-beast-and-bandit-filled forest! Wicked white, my contacts at the Crystarium told me it was meant to be <Emphasis>trained</Emphasis>...
Anyway, we need as many people as possible out there looking for it. Its handler is leading the search─as he <Emphasis>should</Emphasis>─in the Forest of the Lost Shepherd. Go, go!
Why are you still standing here!? Run, run!
You've come to aid in the search? Excellent.
It's this amaro's first time out of the Crystarium, and he got a bit spooked. Took off before I could stop him─it's instinctual, you understand. He should still respond to this, though.
That whistle produces a tone that all of our amaro have been trained since birth to react to. Blow it loudly, and then listen for his cry. If he's nearby, you'll know.
It's possible that he will be too skittish to follow you back. If so, please return here and let me know.
(-Immobile Amaro-)Gwee...
The amaro gives a weak cry at the sound of the whistle, turning his eyes in your direction. Perhaps he will respond to you, if you speak to him soothingly...
(-Immobile Amaro-)Gwee...
You hear the faint cry of an amaro. He must be nearby.
You hear nothing in reply to the shrill tone of the whistle.
The amaro trembles, apparently unable to move due to injury, fear, or both. Hopefully his handler will know what to do.
You're back already? Does that mean you found him?
He can't move!? Poor thing! I must go to him at once!
There, there. You'll be alright.
Gwee!
The amaro's eyes are filled with something like gratitude as it looks toward you.
If you're back, it had better be because you found the amaro...
Oh, you did! In that case─thank you. We really couldn't have afforded to lose such a valuable resource.
